Cloze: Subject pronouns: {{c1::io}}, {{c2::tu}}, {{c3::lui}}, {{c4::lei}}, {{c5::noi}}, {{c6::voi}}, {{c7::loro}}
Back Extra: Subject pronouns identify who performs the action; often dropped unless needed for clarity.

Cloze: 'Lei' vs 'lei': {{c1::Lei}} parla con rispetto, mentre {{c2::lei}} è una ragazza.
Back Extra: 'Lei' is used for formal situations and is capitalized to distinguish it from 'lei' (she).

Cloze: Definite articles: {{c1::Il}} libro, {{c2::lo}} studente, {{c3::la}} casa, {{c4::i}} libri, {{c5::gli}} amici, {{c6::le}} ragazze.
Back Extra: Definite articles (il, lo, la, i, gli, le) are used based on gender, number, and initial sound of the following noun.

Cloze: Indefinite articles: {{c1::un}} libro, {{c2::uno}} studente, {{c3::una}} casa, {{c4::un'}} amica.
Back Extra: Indefinite articles (un, uno, una, un') are used based on gender, number, and initial sound of the following noun.

Cloze: Article usage examples: {{c1::il}} libro, {{c2::una}} casa, {{c3::lo}} studente, {{c4::gli}} amici.
Back Extra: Examples of article usage based on gender and number.

Cloze: Masculine noun example: il {{c1::libro}}; Feminine noun example: la {{c2::casa}}.
Back Extra: Masculine nouns often end in -o, feminine in -a.

Cloze: Plural formation: il {{c1::libro}} → i {{c2::libri}}, la {{c3::casa}} → le {{c4::case}}, la {{c5::classe}} → le {{c6::classi}}.
Back Extra: Masculine: -o → -i, Feminine: -a → -e, Both: -e → -i.

Cloze: Adjective agreement: il libro {{c1::rosso}}, la casa {{c2::rossa}}, i libri {{c3::rossi}}, le case {{c4::rosse}}.
Back Extra: Adjectives must agree in gender and number with the noun.

Cloze: Negation with 'non': {{c1::Non}} parlo italiano, {{c1::Non}} è qui, {{c1::Non}} ho parlato.
Back Extra: Place 'non' directly before the verb to negate it.

Cloze: Negation examples: {{c1::Non}} voglio il caffè, {{c1::Non}} siamo stanchi.
Back Extra: Examples of negation in sentences.

Cloze: Affirmative structure: {{c1::Maria}} {{c2::legge}} il libro.
Back Extra: Subject + Verb + Object structure in affirmative sentences.

Cloze: Negative structure: {{c1::Non}} {{c2::legge}} il libro.
Back Extra: Negation uses 'non' + Verb + Object.

Cloze: Yes/No question: {{c1::Maria}} legge? or {{c2::Che}} Maria legge?
Back Extra: Yes/No questions can be formed by intonation or with 'che'.

Cloze: WH-questions: {{c1::Dove}} vai?, {{c2::Quanto}} costa?, {{c3::Chi}} è?
Back Extra: Common WH-questions include chi, che, dove, quando, perché, come, quanto/a/i/e.

Cloze: WH-question examples: {{c1::Dove}} vai?, {{c2::Quanto}} costa?
Back Extra: Examples of WH-questions in sentences.

Back Extra: Conjugation patterns for -are verbs (parlare).

Cloze: -ere verbs: Io {{c1::credo}}, Tu {{c2::credi}}, Lui/Lei {{c3::crede}}, Noi {{c4::crediamo}}, Voi {{c5::credete}}, Loro {{c6::credono}}.

Cloze: Near demonstratives: {{c1::questo}} libro, {{c2::questa}} casa, {{c3::questi}} amici, {{c4::queste}} ragazze.
